Floral basket to Kim Jong Il from secretary general of IIJI
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il receives letters from servicemen and people and replies to them 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received at least 153,110 letters from servicemen of the Korean People's Army and people from all walks of life and sent over 3,140 autographs over the last 8 years since jan.1, Juche 84 (1995) when he began enforcing the army-based policy.
 He sent his autographic letter to all the people of the country on the morning of the New Year's Day of Juche 84 (1995) upon seeing out the year of bitter grief.    
 He bestowed upon all the servicepersons and people the high honour of being soldiers and students of President Kim Il Sung and encouraged the whole party and army and all people in the sacred struggle to achieve the prosperity of the country, the legacy left by the president.

articles.title: Truth about emergence of nuclear issue on Korean Peninsula disclosed
articles.content:
Floral basket to Kim Jong Il from secretary general of IIJI 
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI) and his party on the occasion of his birthday.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the IIJI, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.content:
Economic and commercial councilors corps visits Kimjongilia Show
    Pyongyang, February 15 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councillors' corps here visited the 7th Kimjongilia show on Feb. 14 on the occasion of the birthday of Kim Jong Il.
 The guests were struck with admiration at seeing Kimjongilias which came into full bloom reflecting the best wishes of the Korean people and the world progressives for Kim Jong Il.    
 Sergei Lyoushkin, commercial councillor of the Russian embassy who is doyen of the corps, wrote in the visitor's book that the ecstasy of the show proves well how deeply the Korean people and the world progressives are respecting and revering Kim Jong Il.
